result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie T Steffen

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephanie T Steffen not in court.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Stephanie T Steffen.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. If no agreement by next hearing, set for trial. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Stephanie T Steffen
Current: 840 N Wisconsin St #115, Elkhorn, WI 53121 United States  (Effective: 08-04-2022)
Prior: N6476 HWY 67, Elkhorn, WI 53121

BOND TO COVER 22GF811, 22CM400 & 22CM380

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.T. dob 12-15-1983. C.M.R. dob 3-26-1984 OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL AT JAIL. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
22-3634

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stephanie T Steffen in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Stephanie T Steffen. New total bond set with all same priors plus no contact. Future dates remain. Minutes filed.
